citation.article-title: Halolactibacillus alkaliphilus sp. nov., a moderately alkaliphilic and halophilic bacterium isolated from a soda lake in Inner Mongolia, China, and emended description of the genus Halolactibacillus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Halolactibacillus Ishikawa et al. 2005
Halolactibacillus [Ha.lo.lac′ti.ba.cil′lus. Gr. n. hals salt; L. n. lac lactis, milk; L. masc. n. bacillus stick, a small rod; N.L. masc. n. Halolactibacillus salt (loving) lactic acid rodlet.
The description is the same as that given by Ishikawa et al. (2005).
In addition, cells are non-motile or motile.
Growth occurs under conditions with or without sugars.
Optimum pH for growth is 8.0–12, with a range of 6.0–13.
Predominant menaquinones include MK-9H4 and MK-9H2.
The G+C content of the DNA is 38.3–40.7 mol%.
